refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Rangetosubnet accepts two IP addresses which define an address range, from start to stop inclusive, and converts this to a subnet if possible. The addresses must both be IPv4 or both be IPv6, and the address family of the resulting subnet is the same.
Rangetosubnet returns NULL for success and a pointer to a string-literal error message for failure; see DIAGNOSTICS.

refsect1.title: DIAGNOSTICS
refsect1.para: Fatal errors in rangetosubnet are: mixed address families; unknown address family; start and stop do not define a subnet.

refsect1.title: HISTORY
refsect1.para: Written for the FreeS/WAN project by Henry Spencer.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: The restriction of error reports to literal strings (so that callers don't need to worry about freeing them or copying them) does limit the precision of error reporting.
